title: Deleted files within deleted directories aren't detected with FS watcher

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
Sometimes, the FsWatcher recognizes a directory as being deleted, but not the contents of this directory. I cannot reliably reproduce this.

Suppose I am in a shared directory, label "default". As a minimal example, I create a new folder and put a single file in it:

    mkdir newfolder
    touch newfolder/newfile

Wait ten seconds, until FsWatcher triggers a sync. The log shows correctly:

    [HU2GR] 00:01:14 VERBOSE: Folder "default" is now scanning
    [HU2GR] 00:01:14 VERBOSE: Local change detected in folder "default": modified dir newfolder
    [HU2GR] 00:01:14 VERBOSE: Local change detected in folder "default": modified file newfolder/newfile
    [HU2GR] 00:01:14 VERBOSE: Folder "default" is now idle
    [HU2GR] 00:01:14 VERBOSE: Folder "default" is now syncing
    [HU2GR] 00:01:17 VERBOSE: Folder "default" is now idle
    [HU2GR] 00:01:18 VERBOSE: Summary for folder "default" is map[localDirectories:2737 globalFiles:8590 inSyncFiles:8590 localBytes:404203037 pullErrors:0 inSyncBytes:404203037 localDeleted:546018 needSymlinks:0 needDirectories:0 needFiles:0 needDeletes:0 globalDirectories:2737 globalDeleted:882565 localFiles:8590 globalSymlinks:0 globalBytes:404203037 localSymlinks:0 needBytes:0 sequence:5339784 version:5339784 state:idle]
    [HU2GR] 00:01:33 VERBOSE: Completion for folder "default" on device ENFQI... is 99.99996833274659%
    [HU2GR] 00:01:52 VERBOSE: Device ENFQI... sent an index update for "default" with 2 items
    [HU2GR] 00:01:59 VERBOSE: Completion for folder "default" on device ENFQI... is 100%

(`ENFQI` being another computer under my control.)

If I delete the directory, like so:

    rm -r newfolder

Then sometimes only the directory will be recognized as deleted:

    [HU2GR] 00:13:14 VERBOSE: Summary for folder "default" is map[localFiles:8589 localDirectories:2737 pullErrors:0 inSyncBytes:404202845 globalFiles:8589 version:5339798 sequence:5339798 needBytes:0 globalSymlinks:0 globalDeleted:882566 needDeletes:0 state:idle globalDirectories:2737 inSyncFiles:8589 needSymlinks:0 localSymlinks:0 localDeleted:546019 needFiles:0 globalBytes:404202845 localBytes:404202845 needDirectories:0]
    [HU2GR] 00:13:16 VERBOSE: Completion for folder "default" on device ENFQI... is 100%
    [HU2GR] 00:14:31 VERBOSE: Folder "default" is now scanning
    [HU2GR] 00:14:31 VERBOSE: Local change detected in folder "default": deleted dir newfolder
    [HU2GR] 00:14:31 VERBOSE: Folder "default" is now idle
    [HU2GR] 00:14:31 VERBOSE: Folder "default" is now syncing
    [HU2GR] 00:14:34 VERBOSE: Folder "default" is now idle
    [HU2GR] 00:14:35 VERBOSE: Summary for folder "default" is map[inSyncBytes:404202717 needSymlinks:0 localDirectories:2736 version:5339799 sequence:5339799 globalDirectories:2736 localSymlinks:0 localFiles:8589 needDirectories:0 globalFiles:8589 needBytes:0 pullErrors:0 inSyncFiles:8589 localDeleted:546020 needFiles:0 needDeletes:0 globalDeleted:882567 globalBytes:404202717 state:idle globalSymlinks:0 localBytes:404202717]
    [HU2GR] 00:14:37 VERBOSE: Completion for folder "default" on device ENFQI... is 95%

The `*Directories` gets decremented, but not the `*Files`. I have to manually sync or wait for the periodic scan to propagate the deleted file. Until then, `ENFQI` (and in fact every other machine that was online at this moment) keeps stuck at 95%. What is happening here?

### Version Information

Syncthing Version: v0.14.47
OS Version: Gentoo Linux, amd64 (x86_64), fully updated (mostly stable packages) a few days ago.
File System in use: BTRFS (in case this is relevant)
